channel.title: Run With Me
channel.description: You run, I run, now we run together.
channel.generator: Feeder 3 3.1.8(2650); Mac OS X Version 10.11.4 (Build 15E65) http://reinventedsoftware.com/feeder/
channel.copyright: 2016 Chris Krycho. License: Creative Commons Attribution
channel.itunes:author: Chris Krycho
channel.itunes:subtitle: A microcast about running, recorded while running. 3–5 minute episodes, released weekly-ish.
channel.itunes:summary: A microcast about running, recorded while running. In 3–5 minute episodes, released weekly-ish, I talk about it all: ups and downs, training, health, nutrition, motivation, racing, weird things your body does on long runs—everything.

item.title: 7: Pushups and Pullups
item.description:
Running isn’t a great way to lose weight—you need to include strength training for that. But it is a great way to get healthy in general.

Check out the run!
item.itunes:summary:
Running isn’t a great way to lose weight—you need to include strength training for that. But it *is* a great way to get healthy in general.
Check out the run!: https://www.strava.com/activities/571998405

item.title: 6: A Run is a Break
item.description:
How sometimes running makes you feel less physically tired, even when you start our incredibly tired physically. Counterintuitive? Maybe. But it's true anyway.

Check out the run!
item.itunes:summary:
How sometimes running makes you feel less physically tired, even when you start our incredibly tired physically. Counterintuitive? Maybe. But it's true anyway.
Check out the run: https://www.strava.com/activities/evening-run-563593692

item.title: 5: A Different Kind of Endurance
item.description:
• Learning to endure over not just one run, but many months, with a training strategy.
  • And also: getting tired by taking a tempo run, a long run, and then a toddler run in a three day span.

Check out the run!
item.itunes:summary:
* Learning to endure over not just one run, but many months, with a training strategy.
* And also: getting tired by taking a tempo run, a long run, and then a toddler run in a three day span.

item.title: 1: Hi, There!
item.description:
I went for a run. And then I invited you to join me! Here's to some great running in the weeks and months, and maybe years, ahead!

Check out the run!
